definition: to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful

sentences.english: Balance is found in the one who faces his guilt.
sentences.chinese: 直面愧疚，内心方获平衡。

sentences.english: With shame and grief he dared no longer look towards that heaven where his father lived.
sentences.chinese: 愧疚悲伤令他不敢望向父亲安息的天堂。

sentences.english: Try not to wallow in feelings of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 不要让自己沉浸在愧疚的深渊里。

sentences.english: God has given us a way to get rid of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 上帝提供给我们一条除去愧疚感的方法。
是令人难受的愧疚之情？

sentences.english: Fear they'll die before I do, and I'll feel guilty.
sentences.chinese: 害怕别人比我先死，我会为此愧疚。

sentences.english: 3- Now, I am writing you this letter of apology to show my deep regret.
sentences.chinese: 我现在写这封信是为了表达我最深的愧疚。

sentences.english: The Hutt had been perfectly happy to go along with the idea of kidnapping his nephew's baby son.
sentences.chinese: 这个赫特人对绑架自己侄孙的想法毫无愧疚。

sentences.english: I was tired of feeling guilty after every purchase.
sentences.chinese: 我对自己每次买东西后的那种愧疚感感到厌倦了。

sentences.english: Aylmer felt guilty remembering the dream.
sentences.chinese: 一想起这个梦，艾尔默便觉得很愧疚。

sentences.english: As we sat in the waiting room, I was overwhelmed by a sense of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 当我们坐在候诊室，我被一阵愧疚感淹没了。

sentences.english: Deaf school principal guilty to go to HanShan side, HanShan sorry to.
sentences.chinese: 聋哑学校校长愧疚地走到韩珊身边，向韩珊抱歉。

sentences.english: And I felt the relentless heaviness of guilt mingled with grief.
Your date might not feel guilty at all about lying to get you into bed.
sentences.chinese: 你的约会对象一点也不会因为把你骗上床而觉得愧疚。

sentences.english: We've all been guilty of selfishness at some time in our lives.
sentences.chinese: 我们都曾因一生中某个时间的私心杂念而愧疚过。

sentences.english: Your guilt complex is a false concept of God and Life.
sentences.chinese: 你的愧疚情结是一种你对上帝的错误看法。

definition: guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
